intro: Micranthes tenuis, commonly known as slenderleaf micranthes, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Micranthes tenuis is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters.
